sanskrit_verse:
चारणाश्च सुपर्णाश्च पुरुषाश्चैव दाम्भिकाः ।
रक्षांसि च पिशाचाश्च तामसीषूत्तमा गतिः ॥ १२.४४॥
transliteration:
cāraṇāśca suparṇāśca puruṣāścaiva dāmbhikāḥ |
rakṣāṃsi ca piśācāśca tāmasīṣūttamā gatiḥ || 12.44||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who dwell in guile, hypocrisy, and perform actions rooted in tamas—such as charlatans, pretenders, celestial beings fallen from dharma, men of false conduct, rakshasas, and pisachas—are aligned with the lowest movement of existence, where consciousness is obscured and distortion prevails.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives only from alignment with Satya-Dharma
Causation arises from the quality of intent and action, not form or birth
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by clarity of consciousness and integrity of conduct
Restoration logic operates through purification of intent and re-alignment with Dharma
Consciousness alignment determines the operative field of justice
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent exhibits behavior classified as 'dāmbhika' THEN initiate consciousness-realignment protocol
IF entity demonstrates persistent tamasic conduct THEN assign completion process under qualified Dharma-advisor
IF individual performs acts categorized as rakshasa or pisacha THEN engage restorative reintegration pathway
IF conduct obscures satvic clarity THEN activate purification sequence via nyaya-based inquiry
IF intent distorts truth THEN disqualify from authoritative roles until realignment verified
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any party found to operate from a dāmbhika or tāmasika orientation shall be subject to immediate referral to a certified Dharma-advisor for restoration prior to continuation of legal proceedings. The court shall recognize that such entities lack capacity for truthful testimony or lawful authority.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that distortion arises from misaligned consciousness, not inherent evil. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that tāmasika conduct manifests sequentially through neglect of svadharma. Responsibility lies in reclaiming satvic clarity. Justice is executed through conscious correction, not punitive consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma-recognition process under certified spiritual mentorship
Assign structured completion sequences for all distorted actions
Implement consciousness-purification regimen guided by tantric-Vedic alignment
Establish accountability framework through witness-bearing community structures
Reintegrate individual upon verified restoration of satvic orientation
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. This law restores Satya, abolishes punitive falsehood, affirms consciousness as the sole arbiter, and upholds the supremacy of divine alignment over human error.
